doc.previous: Another simple and intuitive way to derive the future value of an annuity is to consider an endowment whose interest is paid as the annuity and whose principal remains constant The principal of this hypothetical endowment can be computed as that whose interest equals the annuity payment amount
doc.after: Note that no money enters or leaves the combined system of endowment principal accumulated annuity payments and thus the future value of this system can be computed simply via the future value formula
